title: KKR, partners lower Australia's Latitude IPO price - sources
text:
KKR, partners lower Australia's Latitude IPO price - sources

Stock Markets 24 minutes ago (Oct 14, 2019 10:40)

© Reuters. KKR, partners lower Australia's Latitude IPO price - sources SYDNEY, Oct 14 (Reuters) - U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co KKR.N and its partners have decided to lower the IPO price of their Australian non-bank lender, Latitude Financial, which is due to list in the local bourse on Friday, by at least 11%, two sources told Reuters. It is the second attempt at listing Latitude for KKR, Deutsche Bank and Varde Partners. The trio had filed a prospectus with the regulator last month valuing the finance company at between A$2 and A$2.25 per share. new price being offered is about A$1.78 per share, the sources said, asking not to be identified because they were not allowed to talk to the media. Latitude declined to comment.

KKR, partners lower Australia's Latitude IPO price - sources
